alert.note: Alert for Adams; Allen; Huntington; Wabash; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:18PM EDT until April 01 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Allen County in northeastern Indiana... Southern Wabash County in north central Indiana... Huntington County in northeastern Indiana... Wells County in northeastern Indiana... Adams County in northeastern Indiana... * Until 1215 AM EDT. * At 1118 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Huntington to near Andrews to 7 miles west of La Fontaine, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Huntington, Bluffton, Decatur, Ossian, Markle, La Fontaine, Monroe, Middletown, Warren, Lancaster, Preble, Zanesville, Uniondale, Mount Etna, Vera Cruz, Yoder, Murray, Liberty Center, Peterson and Buckeye. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 273 and 295. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for north central and northeastern Indiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for west central Ohio.
